Antipodal

Antipodal#

#include "navground/sim/scenarios/antipodal.h"
struct AntipodalScenario : public navground::sim::Scenario#

A scenario that place the agents around a circle at regular intervals and task them to reach the opposite (“antipode”) side.

Public Functions

inline AntipodalScenario(float radius = default_radius, float tolerance = default_tolerance, float position_noise = default_position_noise, float orientation_noise = default_orientation_noise, bool shuffle = default_shuffle)#

Constructs a new instance.

inline float get_radius() const#

Gets the circle radius.

Returns:

The radius.

inline void set_radius(float value)#

Sets the circle radius.

Parameters:

value – [in] The desired value

inline float get_tolerance() const#

Gets the goal tolerance.

Returns:

The tolerance.

inline void set_tolerance(float value)#

Sets the goal tolerance.

Parameters:

value – [in] The desired value

inline float get_position_noise() const#

Gets the position_noise.

Returns:

The position_noise.

inline void set_position_noise(float value)#

Sets the position noise.

Parameters:

value – [in] The desired value

inline float get_orientation_noise() const#

Gets the orientation.

Returns:

The orientation noise.

inline void set_orientation_noise(float value)#

Sets the position_noise.

Parameters:

value – [in] The desired value

inline bool get_shuffle() const#

Gets whether it should shuffle the agents before initializing them.

Returns:

True if it shuffles the agents.

inline void set_shuffle(bool value)#

Sets whether it should shuffle the agents.

Parameters:

value – [in] The desired value

Public Static Attributes

static constexpr float default_radius = 1.0f#

The default circle radius

static constexpr float default_tolerance = 0.1f#

The default goal tolerance

static constexpr float default_position_noise = 0.0f#

The default position noise

static constexpr float default_orientation_noise = 0.0f#

The default orientation noise

static constexpr float default_shuffle = false#

The default shuffle
